ai-iti26:1.1_0: For this was said by the Buddha, the Perfected One: that is what I heard.
ai-iti26:2.1_0: “Mendicants, if sentient beings knew that the result of giving and sharing, the result of that they eat without first giving, the stain of stinginess would not be able to eat, and the stain of stinginess regarding fish.
ai-iti26:2.2_0: They would not eat without sharing even their last mouthful, their last morsel, so long as there was someone to receive it.
ai-iti26:2.3_0: It is because sentient beings do not know, as I do, the fruit of giving and sharing, that they eat without first giving, and the stain of stinginess occupies their minds.”
ai-iti26:3.4_0: as taught by the great hermit!
ai-iti26:4.1_0: They’ve driven out the stain of stinginess,
ai-iti26:4.3_0: they would duly give to the noble ones,
ai-iti26:4.4_0: where a gift is very fruitful.
ai-iti26:5.2_0: to those worthy of a religious donation,
ai-iti26:5.3_0: after passing from the human realm,
ai-iti26:6.1_0: And when they have arrived there in heaven,
ai-iti26:6.2_0: they enjoy all the pleasures they desire.
ai-iti26:7.1_0: That is what the Buddha has heard.
